data.question: What is the chemical formula of the compound that combines conducting and magnetic properties and becomes superconducting under moderate pressure?
data.answer: κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3

data.question: What are the synthesis conditions for the Mn[N(CN)2]2 salt used in the preparation of κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 crystals?
data.answer: Mn[N(CN)2]2 was synthesized by the metathesis reaction of MnClO4·6H2O with Na[N(CN)2].

data.question: What method was used to determine the crystal structure of κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3?
data.answer: The crystal structure was determined by the direct method and refined by the full-matrix least-squares method in anisotropic approximation.

data.question: How was the superconducting transition temperature (Tc) of κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 determined?
data.answer: The superconducting transition temperature (Tc) was determined by observing the resistance behavior under a pressure of 0.2-0.4 kbar created by cooling in silicon oil GKZh-136.

data.question: What is the role of the Mn[N(CN)2]2 salt in the synthesis of κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 crystals?
data.answer: The Mn[N(CN)2]2 salt acts as a precursor in the electrocrystallization process to form the polymeric dicyanamidomanganate(II) anion layer in the κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 crystals.

data.question: True or False: The κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 crystals exhibit metal-insulator transition at ambient pressure.
data.answer: True

data.question: True or False: Magnetic measurements for κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 were conducted only in fields up to 7 T.
data.answer: False

data.question: What distinguishes the magnetic properties of κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 from those of BETS salts with FeX4 anions?
data.answer: In κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3, the anion layers have a polymeric structure with paramagnetic ions Mn2+ connected via dicyanamide bridges, favoring a direct exchange interaction within the anion layers, unlike the discrete paramagnetic units in BETS salts with FeX4 anions.

data.question: What experimental technique was used to measure the resistance of κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 crystals?
data.answer: Four-probe d.c. and a.c. resistance measurements were performed on the crystals.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 involved a heating process.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the significance of the dihedral angle between BETS dimers in κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 crystals?
data.answer: The dihedral angle between BETS dimers, similar to other κ-BETS salts, influences the overlapping mode of the BETS radical cations in the dimer, which is realized in all superconductors with the κ-type conducting layers.

data.question: True or False: The superconducting state of κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 is achieved without applying any external pressure.
data.answer: False

data.question: How does the structure of the anion layer in κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 compare to that in the BEDT-TTF salt of similar composition?
data.answer: Unlike the ordered anion in the BEDT-TTF salt, the anion layer in κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 is characterized by a statistically disordered dicyanamide group along the b axis of the unit cell.

data.question: True or False: The magnetic susceptibility of κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 follows the Curie-Weiss law across the entire temperature range studied.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the effect of applying a magnetic field on the superconducting transition of κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3?
data.answer: The superconducting transition is highly sensitive to a magnetic field, indicating the superconducting nature of the transition.

data.question: True or False: The crystal structure of κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 is characterized by a single type of BETS radical cation conformer.
data.answer: False

data.question: What role does pressure play in the superconducting behavior of κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3?
data.answer: Applying a moderate pressure of 0.2-0.4 kbar suppresses the low-temperature increase of resistance and induces a superconducting transition.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 crystals requires the presence of ethanol in the electrocrystallization solution.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the primary difference in the magnetic anion layers between κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 and salts of BETS with FeX4 anions?
data.answer: The primary difference is that κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 has polymeric anion layers with Mn2+ ions connected via dicyanamide bridges, whereas BETS salts with FeX4 anions have discrete paramagnetic units.

data.question: True or False: The resistance measurements of κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 were conducted only along the plane of conducting layers.
data.answer: False
